intro: Acritopappus heterolepis, commonly known as the roughleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually rough and hairy, with a grayish-green color, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. The plant is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
